learnings: Must verify availability of all required file contexts (e.g., README, source files) before generating code that depends on them.
Success status in action execution does not guarantee meaningful output; content validation is necessary.
unexpectedEvents: The code generation process returned a success flag while containing an error in the generated code content.
The error message was directly embedded in the output without fallback or graceful handling for missing context.

whatWorked: The code generation action executed without runtime errors and returned a success status
The process correctly identified and reported the issue of missing files in the output
whatFailed: No comprehensive markdown report was generated as intended
The output contained an error message instead of the expected project analysis
Required project files (README, App.tsx, main.tsx, App.test.tsx, package.json) were not accessible during generation
reflection.rootCause: The AI lacked access to the necessary project files in the workspace context, preventing the synthesis of the report based on actual file contents. The generation process proceeded without verifying file availability, leading to an embedded error in the output.
suggestedChanges: Verify availability of all required files in the workspace context before starting report generation
Implement a pre-check to confirm file access and abort gracefully with a clear message if files are missing
Adjust the plan to handle partial information if only some files are available, strictly avoiding hallucinations per anti-hallucination rules
Ensure the action explicitly requests or confirms file context in the workspace to prevent similar issues
reflection.knowledgeGained: A successful execution status does not guarantee correct output if dependent resources are missing. Context verification and robust error handling are critical for reliable AI code generation, especially when relying on external file inputs.
